docs.lead_paragraph: ITHACA, N. Y. THE black girls' cooperative at Cornell University is a large frame house on Dearborn Street close to the campus. Nearby are other frame houses occupied by private families, white families. Until recently, the glass panel of the co-op's front door had the word "Wari" -Swahili for "home" -- stenciled across it; now the door is freshly painted and unobtrusive among the others.

headline.main: The Black Studies Thing; Cornell's experience indicates why, all over the country, so much stress is being put on

docs.abstract: E Dunbar article on role of univ under pres Perkins in admitting educationally disadvantaged Negroes and degree to which univ has moved toward meeting Negro student demands for black studies program; illus
